name: df-rngohom
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4
body: |- wceq(crnghom, cmpo(s0, s1, crngo, crngo, crab(s2, co(crn(cfv(c1st, cv(s1))), cmap, crn(cfv(c1st, cv(s0)))), wa(wceq(cfv(cv(s2), cfv(cgi, cfv(c2nd, cv(s0)))), cfv(cgi, cfv(c2nd, cv(s1)))), wral(s3, crn(cfv(c1st, cv(s0))), wral(s4, crn(cfv(c1st, cv(s0))), wa(wceq(cfv(cv(s2), co(cv(s3), cfv(c1st, cv(s0)), cv(s4))), co(cfv(cv(s2), cv(s3)), cfv(c1st, cv(s1)), cfv(cv(s2), cv(s4)))), wceq(cfv(cv(s2), co(cv(s3), cfv(c2nd, cv(s0)), cv(s4))), co(cfv(cv(s2), cv(s3)), cfv(c2nd, cv(s1)), cfv(cv(s2), cv(s4)))))))))))
comment: Define the function which gives the set of ring homomorphisms between two given rings. (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 19-Jun-2010.)
